description: [MSF] Geneva -- In September 2023, the US corporation Danaher, which owns diagnostics maker Cepheid, announced a price reduction of the primary GeneXpert test used to diagnose tuberculosis (TB), from US$9.98 (R181,54) to $7.97 (R144,98), amid pressure from TB activists. Since then, officials from the Ministries of Health of Sierra Leone, Ghana, Ukraine, Belarus and several other low- and middle-income countries have written to Danaher, requesting that the price of the tests for HIV, hepatitis and drug-resistant TB
title: Africa: U.S. Corporation Danaher Requested to Reduce Medical Tests Prices

description: [The Independent Panel] Madrid -- New report led by Ellen Johnson Sirleaf and Helen Clark proposes actions that must be implemented to help make the world safer
title: Africa: Leaders Must Unite to Prevent Pandemics - Report

description: [The Conversation Africa] In 2020 the World Health Organization rolled out a global strategy to eradicate cervical cancer by 2030. This is the fourth-most common cancer among women, claiming an estimated 350,000 lives globally in 2022. More than 80,000 of these deaths were recorded in sub-Saharan Africa. Currently, one woman dies every two minutes from this disease, which is caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV). Cervical cancer is preventable. The global strategy has three pillars: getting 90% of girls vaccinated against HPV
title: Africa: What Is Cervical Cancer and How Can It Be Prevented? Answers to Key Questions

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Heifer International Kenya has officially launched the 2024 AYuTe Africa Challenge.
title: Africa: Heifer International Kenya Launches 2024 Ayute Africa Challenge

description: [Ethiopian Herald] ADDIS ABABA -- Africa and Latin America should have better representation in international institutions so that their voices can be heard, the Prosperity Party Vice President said.
title: Africa: PP VP Emphasizes Africa, Latin America's Broader Representation

description: [The Conversation Africa] What should I study? What do I want to be? How will I pay for my education? Who do I want to spend the rest of my life with? These are the life-changing decisions many young people face.
title: Africa: Romantic Breakups Can Spark Severe Trauma in Young People - New Study

description: [Business Day Africa] Qatar Airways is set to acquire a 49 percent stake in RwandAir next month, concluding nearly five years of negotiations with the East African-based carrier.
title: Africa: Qatar Steps Up Aviation Rivalry in Africa With Billion-Dollar RwandAir Stake

description: [RFI] France is planning to reduce its military presence in West and Central Africa to around 600 troops in line with President Emmanuel Macron's plans to limit the French military footprint in the region.
title: Central Africa: France to Reduce Military Presence in West and Central Africa

description: [IPS] Colombo, Sri Lanka -- Today Small Island Developing States (SIDS) and the environmental threats they confront require our urgent attention --and the global spotlight needs to be trained deliberately and maintained consistently on their concerns, in particular, climate change, marine biological diversity loss and sustainable development goals (SDGs).
title: Africa: Sustainable Development of 39 Small Island Developing States - No Time to Wait

description: [IPS] United Nations -- When the 193-member UN General Assembly adopted a landmark resolution, back in September 2015, the goals were highly ambitious: to eradicate extreme poverty and hunger, eliminate inequalities, protect human rights, promote gender empowerment and ensure economic, social and environmental development--and much more.
title: Africa: UN's Development Goals - Rich Nations Lead While World's Poor Lag Far Behind

description: [DW] Rescuers from a German rescue group said 10 bodies were found on a wooden boat in the Mediterranean during a rescue operation.
title: Africa: German Rescue Group - 10 Migrants Found Dead in Mediterranean

description: [This Day] As Africa continues to transition towards a more diversified and sustainable economic model, Grema Sulaiman believes as Director General of the Centre for Energy Investment and Innovation (CEII) Aliko Dangote and the Dangote Group role remains pivotal and holds immense potential for continued innovation and growth in Africa. Not only are they reshaping the energy landscape for a just transition in Africa, but they are also inspiring a new generation of African entrepreneurs to think big and act boldly,
title: Africa: How Dangote Is Pioneering Africa's Energy Transition - Grema Sulaiman

description: [Premium Times] President Tinubu will return to Nigeria after the ceremony.
title: Africa: Tinubu to Attend Ramaphosa's Inauguration in South Africa

description: [Accra Times] President Akufo-Addo has attributed high inflation and increased food insecurity on the continent to the Russia-Ukraine war.
title: Africa: Africa 'Accidental Victim' of Russia-Ukraine War - Akufo-Addo

description: [The Conversation Africa] Time magazine has dubbed 2024 a "super election year". An astonishing 4 billion people are eligible to vote in countries across the world this year. Many are on the African continent, where presidential, parliamentary and general elections have already been held or are set for the latter half of the year.
title: Africa: AI Can Make African Elections More Efficient - but Trust Must Be Built and Proper Rules Put in Place

description: [African Arguments] An expert panel give their verdict on critical climate negotiations at the just-concluded conference in Bonn.
title: Africa: 'Patience Is Running Out' - Did Bonn Make Progress On Climate Finance?

description: [UN News] Sustainable sources of energy, including solar and wind power, can help communities across the world to reverse desertification and land loss, according to Ibrahim Thiaw, the Executive Secretary of the UN Convention to Combat Desertification.
title: Africa: Sustainable Energy Offers 'Hope' in Fight Against Desertification and Land Loss
